intro: Ditaxis cyanophylla, commonly known as the blue-leafed dittany, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy texture. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
